document.docAuthor: Burks, Roger A., Heraty, John M., Dominguez, Chrysalyn & Mottern, Jason L.
document.docTitle: Orasema arimbome Burks & Heraty & Dominguez & Mottern 2018, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Complex diversity in a mainly tropical group of ant parasitoids: Revision of the Orasema stramineipes species group (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Eucharitidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Complex diversity in a mainly tropical group of ant parasitoids: Revision of the Orasema stramineipes species group (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Eucharitidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. F2 longer than F3; funiculars dark brown. Mesoscutal midlobe and mesoscutellar disc areolate; mesoscutal midlobe with a forked or paired reddish area anteriorly. Axilla with distinct longitudinal and oblique carinae anteriorly (dorsally). Axillula areolate but with some longitudinal carinae. Stigmal vein narrow, at nearly a right angle with wing margin. Propodeum medially without reticulate sculpture.

This species is similar to
O. stramineipes
and
O. yaax
in having a usually large body size, but more strongly resembles
O. pirca
and others with a completely areolate axillula. It is especially similar to
O. pirca
, from which it differs in having some longitudinal axillular carinae amidst its areolate sculpture ( Fig. 15 ) instead of having a regularly areolate axillula, and in having a differently shaped stigmal vein ( Fig. 16 versus Fig. 160 ). These differences are slight, but are upheld by distinctive molecular differences.

Color: Head and mesosoma green with reddish to yellowish luster on the mesoscutum medially, axilla laterally, and at frenal groove. Pedicel pale brown; anellus pale brown; flagellum brown. Coxae brown to greenish; fore femur mostly brown, tips pale; mid and hind femora yellow. Fore wing slightly infuscate ( Fig. 11 ); venation dark brown. Petiole green; gaster brown to green.

Head: Head width:head height 1.1; face reticulate; longitudinal groove between eye and torulus present; eyes bare, inter-ocular distance:eye height 1.5–1.6; malar space:eye height 0.6–0.8; supraclypeal area longer than broad, smooth; clypeus smooth. Flagellum length:head height 11.6; F2 3.0–3.3× as long as broad, 1.3× as long as F3; following funiculars subequal in width, progressively shorter.

Mesosoma: Mesosoma length:height 1.4–1.5. Mesoscutal midlobe coarsely areolate, with minute setae; lateral lobe areolate to nearly smooth. Axilla areolate with some longitudinal and oblique carinae anteriorly (dorsally); mesoscutellar disc areolate, with broader sculpture posteriorly; frenal line irregularly foveate; frenum areolatereticulate; axillular groove anteriorly absent, broad and foveate posteriorly; axillula areolate-reticulate with longitudinal carinae. Propodeum areolate, with irregular or no median carina; propodeal disc areolate; callus areolate-reticulate, with 3–5 setae. Mesepisternum areolate-reticulate laterally, smooth ventrally, broadly rounded anterior to mid coxa. Upper mesepimeron smooth; lower mesepimeron areolate-reticulate; transepimeral sulcus distinct. Metepisternum laterally nearly smooth dorsally, areolate-reticulate ventrally. Hind coxa 2.1–2.3× as long as broad; hind femur 6.4–7.8× as long as broad. Fore wing 2.6–2.7× as long as broad, 2.9–3.0× as long as mesothorax; stigma with 5 sensilla, 2 basal and 3 apical. Hind wing costal cell with a broad bare area.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11–16.
Orasema arimbome
. ♀: 11. Habitus (holotype). 12. Head, cly = clypeus, scly = supraclypeal area. 13. Antenna (holotype), with F2 and F6–F7 inset, F1 = anellus, F2–F8 = funiculars, ped = pedicel, scp = scape. 14. Mesosoma (holotype), dorsal view, ax = axilla, llm = mesoscutal lateral lobe, mlm = mesoscutal midlobe. 15. Oblique view of mesoscutellum, axl = axillula, frn = frenum, scd = mesoscutellar disc. 16. Stigma and postmarginal vein, pmv = postmarginal vein, stv = stigma vein, cc = costal cell.

subSubSection.paragraph: Metasoma: Petiole 2.7–2.8× as long as broad, 1.0–1.2× as long as hind coxa, areolate but sometimes nearly smooth anteriorly, anterior carina moderate. Antecostal sulcus crossed by carinae; acrosternite posteriorly angulate.

Male. Length 3.5–3.7 mm . Head width:head height 1.2; scape pale brown; flagellum length:head height 2.0– 2.1, F2 2.2–2.6× as long as broad. Fore femur mostly brown, tips pale; fore tibia yellow; mid femur mostly dark brown basally, becoming yellow apically; mid tibia yellow; hind femur mostly brown, tips pale. hind tibia yellow. Petiole 7.0–7.6× as long as broad, petiole length:hind coxa length 2.2–2.3.

Distribution.
Costa Rica
,
Guatemala
, Honduras ,
Panama
.
